statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Cincinnati 60, Miami (Ohio) 52
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Jamual Warren scored 15 points, including two crucial baskets in the final minutes, to help Cincinnati take a 60-52 victory over Miami of Ohio on Wednesday. The Bearcats (9-3) extended their winning streak against Miami (4-8) to nine consecutive games. The score was tied at 52 with 2:24 remaining, but two consecutive baskets by Warren, including a dunk off his own steal, quickly gave Cincinnati a 56-52 lead. Marcus Sikes also had 15 points and added 10 rebounds for the Bearcats. Miami's Nathan Peavy led all scorers with 22 points and had 12 rebounds. The RedHawks connected on three of their first four attempts from 3-point range to grab an early 11-7 lead. But Cincinnati pulled ahead 23-17 later in the half as Sikes barely beat the shot clock with a long 3-pointer to cap a 14-2 Bearcats run. A baseline jumper by Bearcats guard Marvin Gentry beat the first-half buzzer to make the score 31-22 at halftime. Gentry finished with eight points. Cincinnati led 37-25 early in the second half, but the RedHawks responded with a 12-0 run to tie the score at 37. John Williamson's dunk off a pass from Warren put the Bearcats ahead 48-42, but the RedHawks again roared back taking a 52-50 lead with less than four minutes left.
